utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, everyone. I'm Dana Perino along with Judge Jeanine Pirro, Richard Fowler, Jesse Watters and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5:00 in New York City. This is "The Five."

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: But we're facing a lot of pushback especially from some of the Republican governors. I proposed requirement for COVID vaccines, and the governor of that state calls it "a tyrannical type move?" A "tyrannical typed move?" This is the worst kind of politics because it's putting the lives of citizens of their states, especially children, at risk.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: President Biden ramping up his attacks on red state governors as his vaccine mandates sharply divides the country. A majority of Americans disapprove of the president's plan to force a shot on over 100 million American workers by a margin of 51 to 48 percent. President Biden not the only one ramping up his rhetoric. CNN's Don Lemon taking his insults against unvaccinated Americans to a whole new level.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: I think we have to stop cuddling people when it comes to this and the vaccine saying, oh, you can't shame them. You can't call them stupid. You can't call them (inaudible). Yes, they are. The people who aided and abetted Trump are stupid because they believed his big lie. The people who are not getting vaccines, who are believing the lies on the internet instead of science, it's time to start shaming them. What else -- or leave them behind because they are keeping the majority of Americans behind.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Leave them behind where? Greg, Republican voters who are not vaccinated or not the only ones who are not vaccinated.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That is what's so frustrating.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, I think it's frustrating because, you know, Don Lemon is extremely stupid. Right? And he thinks that like by calling other people stupid, would he have the balls for example to call 44 percent of Black stupid, right? He thinks that everybody is this amorphous, like red hat wearing group of people who live out in the sticks. When in fact, there is a whole bunch of categories of people who are not vaccinated. One of them are people that are young and very fit and think that they can risk the virus. I know a few of those people. You have women who are either pregnant or want to get pregnant and they're -- they have an extra layer of concern that other people don't have. You know blacks that are superstitious of any medical intervention from the government because, hey, Tuskegee. You have people that are immunocompromised. These are all -- there are a whole sort of people. If you broke this all down, you would find that it's not just a bunch of stupid people. So -- I think there's a reason why this is happening because there is a sensible alternative which is letting people get vaxxed at the pace they decide to without bullying them, which is kind of what's happening. If people just like have conversations like I talked about getting the vaccine with people who haven't, like tussle with skeptics, but I don't like -- I don't -- I respect him. That's life, and I listen to the reasons. And a lot of the reasons do make sense. Like if they are worried about childbearing, that's fine. But they chose this easy target because it allows them to create another team sport oppositional kind of thing for a cable news and for Joe Biden so that you will not look at the other problem. So if you -- if -- what's my - - what did I used to say? If America fights among themselves, the people in power escape our collective wrath. That's what they're doing. If we were unified in anything, then we could focus on crime, homelessness, drug addiction, the border --

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Afghanistan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- Afghanistan. But as long as Joe Biden pits us against each other, that will distract them. And as long as CNN has this kind of like artificial battle to contend with, they might survive another year. But they are bleeding viewers because they don't have the us versus them, you know, dichotomy anymore. Trump's not there. They can't pit Trump versus anti-Trumpers. They can't do right versus left because a lot of people on the left are leaving the left. So what they are trying to do is vax versus anti-vax and that allows them to get up on their porch like -- and it's or -- not parch, perch, and call people stupid. And it's -- all it is to maintain a certain amount of power, keep the plebes busy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, but the way they are saying --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You weren't even listening, Judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I was nodding my head most of the time. And we made eye contact. I saw it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We did. I thought you were flirting.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But look, here's the thing. You thought -- here's the thing. Now I'm going to lose my train of thought.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Wait? Are you cheating on me with him?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No. I'm cheating --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wait? Where is Harold?

utterances.speaker: RICHARD FOWLER, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: The tangled web --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes. What is going on? Okay. When they say that the -- it was the vaxxed versus the un-vaxxed, he is turning the unvaxxed into Republicans.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: So he is continuing the left versus Republicans. It's the smart people versus the Trump people. And that's just not the case because in some of the studies, they say it's that most educated people who are resistant to getting the vaccine. In New York City, it is the minority community that is resistant to getting the vaccine. So if anybody is stupid here, it's Don Lemon and maybe he ought to keep his mouth shut on that stuff if he doesn't know what he's talking about.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, he's an expert in stupidity. That's the thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Richard, what should we know about, you know, the black community and hesitation because obviously there are -- at the cross (inaudible) we're talking in the green room about all of this so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why does it have to be about color?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Green? But not tell us about the minority communities, Richard. You know.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Well, I think there's some -- there is (inaudible) data coming out next week by a group that I know, HIT Strategies who does a tracking poll amongst African-Americans called BlackTrack. I'm looking forward to see what their data says about how black folks feel, their attitude towards the vaccine. But I do think this. Look, I am here for the mandates, but I don't think you can have a mandate and then shame folks who don't get the vaccine. I think you have to take that approach that doctors take when you walk in to their office and you say you're unvaccinated. They treat you with no judgment and then they begin the education process, right? What questions do you have? What are your apprehensions? How can I help answer your question? How can I help sooth your apprehension? How can I help deal with your fears, right, and begin to have this conversation. At the beginning of the pandemic, on my Instagram, I had a virologist and I asked her questions about the pandemic. And I'm willing to do it again for those folks who have questions about the vaccine.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's a good idea.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Right? And to just so we can -- and I'm happy to, right, because I think it's but educators --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're the real hero.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I try my best. Right? Because, listen, because I don't want to see another American, another black, white, yellow, purple, green die from this vaccine -- die from this pandemic. I want America to beat this pandemic. I want the globe to beat this pandemic. And because there are so many countries that are like waiting in line to get the vaccine, we have the vaccine in this country readily available. And so the only way we can beat it is by educating folks as fast and as quick as possible in getting folks to take the jab. And we have to educate people and not shame them.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Can I mention one thing, Jesse, and then we'll get all of your comments on this or otherwise? So, there's 24 attorney's general in the United States that are going -- from the states -- they are going to sue the federal government. They are Republicans. Here's what they say, "That the vaccines have helped protect millions of Americans and there are surely others who could benefit from obtaining this treatment. But convincing those who are hesitant to do so would require you to allow room for discussion and disagreement. Instead, you have offered the American people flimsy legal argument, contradictory statements and threatening directives. It is almost as if your goal is to sow division and distress rather than promote unity and the public's health. So we'll see where that lawsuit goes.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Well, the Democrats don't want to have a conversation. If you have a conversation or you even ask a question, you get nuked up social media. They don't want that. They want brute force because that's their agenda. Now, if I were president, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This is how I would handle it. First, I would thank the American people for my 50 state victory. It's quite an honor. And then I would focus less on the unvaxxed. I would focus more on the benefits of vaccines. I would say, Americans, you know, you're always chasing the fountain of youth. You know, we all want to live longer. We don't want to die young. You get a shot, you are going to live longer, and that's a fact. And I would say, hey, we're living normally. We're not wearing mask. We're doing our thing over here. Life is good. Come join us. That's the way to do it instead of shaming and calling people stupid. I would never call people stupid in this country. I would just quiz them on civics and put movie clips in the (inaudible). That's how I would handle it. But Dana, we're -- to your point, Greg, we're making a lot of progress -- 76 percent of the American people have gotten at least one shot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: In the summer, we were talking 50 percent, 60 percent. We're at 76 percent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We should be actually kind of giving ourselves a pat on the back and then a jab in the arm, but a pat on the back. We're making progress. We don't need to start punishing Americans. We need to start punishing China. Say it, Richard. China.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: China.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: China.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: American people, we would support --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: China.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- Joe Biden if he was more unifying here in this country and hey, let's come together and say, let's punish China and make China pay because Americans have paid enough.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But I wonder, what is enough? I mean, is 80 percent enough? 90 percent enough? I mean, are they going to continue this? I mean, more variants are going to be coming in from other countries.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It shouldn't be about getting to 100 percent. It should be about we got therapeutics. We got vaccines. We're going to live with it and that's life.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You're on your own.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: But how do you deal with the misinformation like the anecdote (ph) that was put up by Nicki Minaj, right, which is a false anecdote, misinformation at its finest that impacted the globe, right? I mean, the health department of Trinidad had to stop what they were doing to correct fatal misinformation.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Consider (ph).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What did Nicki Minaj say, Richard?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to be repeat it. I refuse to say it on air.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She brought up her cousin's friend's part of his anatomy that I will not mention here that swelled up due to it. And it brings up a really good point about assessing just any kind of anecdotal -- you need a control group. So, if -- let's say you get the jab. Ten million people get the jab and the next day, 25 of them get in car accidents. Is that the correlation or causation? No, you have to look and see, find another group of 10 million and see what the rate of car accidents are among them. You might find that people gotten fewer car accidents. So the idea of like, I talked to a lot of people that self-report symptoms and you go, you have to understand, those symptoms might have been their jab or not. You have to compare it to a control group of similar types. You also have to look at comorbidities. When a young person says I still got it you would see that they're really, really obese, which the news never tells you the weight, which you have to ask yourself, why are they so quick to shame the unvaxxed, but when you're super fit, they -- when you're super fit and you are unvaxxed somehow you're shamed, but if somebody is obese, oh, you better not say anything.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Well, Greg, to be fair. To Nicki -- to reference Nicki Minaj's tweet, if I was -- I'm not a doctor but I'm healthcare adjacent because of people in my life.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Right. If that were --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Healthcare adjacent.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: If somebody walk into --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's like --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Am I healthcare adjacent because I'm sitting next to someone who is --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: No. You're healthcare adjacent adjacent. But if somebody walks into a doctor's office and said here are my symptoms and I just took the COVID vaccine --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: -- I'm pretty sure they'll be like, well, let's take some STI test before we say that --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, that's exactly what would happen, yes, because, yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It was right before a wedding. Clearly, he was at a bachelor party.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. Ahead, Republicans demand an answer as the heat turns up on General Mark Milley's call with China.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Fox News alert. The Durham investigation has an indictment. A lawyer whose firm represented Hillary Clinton's campaign is charged with lying to the FBI. Let's go to David Spunt for those breaking news.

utterances.speaker: DAVID SPUNT, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Hi, Jesse. This attorney's name is Michael Sussmann. He is a well-known cyber security attorney here in Washington, D.C. He was just indicted a couple of hours ago by a federal grand jury as you mentioned, for lying to the FBI. And essentially what happened, September 19, 2016, almost five years ago to the day, Mr. Sussmann met with the FBI general counsel to meet with him and allege that then-candidate Donald Trump had connections to Russia. Negative connections to Russia. What Mr. Sussmann did not disclose according to Special Counsel John Durham is that not only did he worked for the DNC in 2016. He also did some work for the Hillary Clinton campaign. That is the crux of this story. He makes his first appearance before a federal judge tomorrow. This is the second indictment in the John Durham special counsel investigation. Back to you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Thanks, David. And we're going to keep you guys updated on that story as it develops. Meantime, more fall out for the Biden administration after saying its got total confidence in General Mark Milley. Remember the new book claiming the general called China to undermine Trump? And so far, nobody is denying that the calls took place. The key now is to find out what was said. And Republican lawmakers are demanding answers.

utterances.speaker: NIKKI HALEY, FORMER U.S. AMBASSADOR TO U.N.
utterances.sentences: And for you to go and have the call with the Chinese, there's nothing wrong with that. For you not to tell the president that you had that call with the Chinese and for him not to be aware that's the problem. Is because you want him to be all informed and at his best to proceed. You don't have the back of the Chinese. You have the back of your president.

utterances.speaker: JOHN RATCLIFFE, FORMER DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE
utterances.sentences: If in fact that is true, then those would be individual counts of insubordination and the appropriate, you know, action would be, you know, court-martial proceeding.

utterances.speaker: REP. JIM JORDAN (R-OH)
utterances.sentences: He actually told the Chinese, hey, if we're going to do something, we're going to give you a heads up? I mean, that is so unconstitutional, so wrong.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And Republican Senator John Kennedy is suggesting Biden might scapegoat Milley to distract from his Afghanistan failure.

utterances.speaker: SEN. JOHN KENNEDY (R-LA)
utterances.sentences: I know President Biden has said he will stand behind General Milley. And maybe that's true for the short term, but I'm going to give you even odds that eventually the White House throws him under the bus. Because the White House desperately needs someone besides President Biden on which to blame the stunning incompetence in Afghanistan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Let's hear your predictions, Judge. Does Milley skate on this or does he get canned?

utterances.speaker: PORRI
utterances.sentences: You know, I don't have the slightest idea. But what I can't tell you is this. If things get really bad, if the coronavirus, I mean, if they can't get more people vaccinated, the economy is going to -- can I say it? And, yes, Afghanistan is a mess. We're leaving Americans behind. The border is a mess. Inflation is a mess. I mean, somebody has got to go. If anyone goes, he goes. Look, and I wouldn't be sorry to hear him going because apparently there's only two people who can give him permission to call his Chinese counterpart, assuming that he said what Woodward is a saying he said, and that is the president or the acting secretary of defense which was this guy, Miller. And that both have said we didn't give him permission to do that. So, you know, it's all about civilian control over the military. I don't like him responding to Nancy Pelosi's calls where she is screaming after January 6th. He gets his withies in a tizzy and he decides that he's going to go to everybody who is involved in the nuclear weapons issue and he's going to tell them come to me first? Since when do they come to you first? You go to the president first.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Nancy Pelosi is not in the chain of command. All of a sudden she is, Richard. How did that happen?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I can't speak to that, but --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's the topic.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: No, I'm going to -- the topic is whether or not he spoke to the Chinese.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I know, but that's a part of the story. Speak to it, Richard. The floor is yours.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Only in your mind. But I think we should work at actually getting all the facts before we just jump to conclusions. Number one --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why would we do that?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Well, because we're the news, maybe.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Well, but number one, any time a book publisher is releasing a book, what they do is they find the most salacious lines of the book and they release them out so people like us can chew over them and because our politics has become so absolutism, so people like the politicians that we just saw there, most of them will likely be 2020 --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But Milley didn't deny it.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Hold on a minute, judge. Hold on a minute --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: He didn't deny it.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Hold -- because he's not -- he's doing his job. He's not going to deny it. He's not going to get in the weeds on this. His job is to run the military. So what you have is --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: To advise the president. That's his job.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: What you have here --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: He should advise him.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: What you have here is a line released from a book, right, that was clearly sensationalized and then you have actual journalists supporting like our very own Jennifer Griffin who reported that number one, this call didn't happen in secret. Number two, the first call that happened with the Chinese general and with Milley involved was a call that was initiated by the Defense Secretary Esper. And so, before we get into this -- and we also had our very own Jack Keane who talked about this and says before we jump, let's get all the facts, number one, and let's not call for transcripts because many times, when these calls happen, they happen in secret because they could be talking about a lot of things. The moment this stuff gets started -- gets released out to the public, we destroyed back channels that we have between us and other foreign governments, especially foreign governments that we have bad relationships with because you don't -- we want to be able to --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I do the Ukraine phone call.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: -- obscure the idea of us going to nuclear war with them.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That is -- that is the Pentagon's opinion. Dana, do you think when Woodward and Costa reported this that maybe they got a leak of the transcripts? Do you think someone told them who was on the call exactly what happened? It's not like they would make something like this up.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Okay. Well, all right. Well, I don't know if there's a transcript. I don't even know if there are transcript of those -- there might be transcripts at the Defense Department. I don't know how that works. I would doubt that they got a transcript. I would imagine that this was a description of what was happening in general. It's because -- actually the accusation is quite general. And that's why we're saying well, we -- could we get the facts to find out what was said and then what was the chain of command? So, did the secretary of defense know or did the secretary of defense's deputy know? Is that good enough? I don't know. He'll have to answer that as will. Well, I also wonder about this because Costa and Woodward are not just any old authors like somebody who wrote "How I Saved the World," "Everything Will Be Okay" or "The Plus." Okay, nothing in the books that we write --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Don't pander with me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- is actually news -- is actually like, you know, breaking news.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: These two are, well, especially Costa. He is a reporter for "The Washington Post." General Milley is the -- in the office of the Joint Chiefs. He is advising a president as we speak, Trump and then Biden. So, if this guy is usurping the commander-in-chief that's big news.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And that should not be held to have a one line leak to sell a bunch of books for us to then find out next week that actually it was all nuance and context doesn't actually allow us to ruin this guy's life? So I'm skeptical about it. I'm not saying it didn't happen. I just don't know and I'm curious about how comfortable the authors are that this is happening.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And if you're Joe Biden, you can't trust this guy, Milley, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't know if he knows what's going on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Joe?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I mean, Joe. Yes. I do enjoy the cognitive dissonance and people who can just easily reverse this. Say it's a general going around Joe Biden's back because he believes that that mental decline has become so serious that we've got to do something. The people that would be defending Milley right now would be condemning Milley. So, you have to like to step back and do kind of like a comparison. We have impeached for less, you know, the phone calls. We've already had two phone calls under Joe Biden. We've had the call to the Afghan president to instruct him to lie. I'm sure there was nuance to that. Milley to China. They're a little bit -- you know, do we know what was on behalf of our country or was it on the behalf of something else?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not perfect phone calls.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Not perfect phone calls.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Not perfect.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, I -- Milley is a symptom of the emotional spasm that went on from 2016 to 2020. It wasn't the Americans who are having the spasm. It was the media, the people in power. It caused them to overlook a virus that was spreading out of China. It caused them to overlook riots and looting across the country. A concerted effort to disqualify law enforcement all because they hated this guy who had mean tweets and made mean jokes who is an outsider calling B.S. on all of these people, right? So, this is about getting rid of the most dangerous president in world history, the one, you know, who removed the threat of North Korea from the table, who ushered in peace from the Middle East, the Abraham Accord, who helped Operation Warp Speed begin, get off the ground, and didn't take a paycheck. Didn't take a paycheck. And yet adults like Milley have deluded themselves into thinking that this guy would invade China. That's -- this is -- that's what this is about. It's about the delusion.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: But how do you know that? I mean --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's part of the story.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Yes, but there's no facts on this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: China is concerned -- no, China called and said we're concerned about Trump. I'd say screw you. You better be.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There weren't any facts with Russia collision and you guys ran with that forever. Ahead, yet another surge at the southern border as Biden's crisis gets even worse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Another self-created crisis gets worse for President Biden. Drone footage capturing thousands of migrants under a bridge in Del Rio, Texas. New Border Patrol numbers say there were more than 200,000 migrants encounters in August including over 18,000 children. And new images show more kids abandoned at the border. Agents rescued a toddler and her infant brother who were left with a note saying they're siblings. How nice, Dana, they've left a note. You know, if this happened under Trump, the media would be calling them Trump's children, right? They call -- they'd call them Trump's babies or whatever.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They would definitely blame him. And actually, the silence from a lot of the media on this is really disturbing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: How could it be that this is now Biden's fourth-worst crisis?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, so you have Afghanistan, COVID inflation, and then 208,000 people in August alone come in across the border, abandoned children. The Border Patrol is completely overwhelmed. And the national -- maybe the national focus is not on this issue. But I'll tell you where it is. You know blacks that are superstitious of any medical intervention from the government because, hey, Tuskegee. You have people that are immunocompromised. These are all -- there are a whole sort of people. If you broke this all down, you would find that it's not just a bunch of stupid people. So -- I think there's a reason why this is happening because there is a sensible alternative which is letting people get vaxxed at the pace they decide to without bullying them, which is kind of what's happening. If people just like have conversations like I talked about getting the vaccine with people who haven't, like tussle with skeptics, but I don't like -- I don't -- I respect him. That's life, and I listen to the reasons. And a lot of the reasons do make sense. Like if they are worried about childbearing, that's fine. But they chose this easy target because it allows them to create another team sport oppositional kind of thing for a cable news and for Joe Biden so that you will not look at the other problem. So if you -- if -- what's my - - what did I used to say? If America fights among themselves, the people in power escape our collective wrath. That's what they're doing. If we were unified in anything, then we could focus on crime, homelessness, drug addiction, the border --

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Afghanistan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- Afghanistan. But as long as Joe Biden pits us against each other, that will distract them. And as long as CNN has this kind of like artificial battle to contend with, they might survive another year. But they are bleeding viewers because they don't have the us versus them, you know, dichotomy anymore. Trump's not there. They can't pit Trump versus anti-Trumpers. They can't do right versus left because a lot of people on the left are leaving the left. So what they are trying to do is vax versus anti-vax and that allows them to get up on their porch like -- and it's or -- not parch, perch, and call people stupid. And it's -- all it is to maintain a certain amount of power, keep the plebes busy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, but the way they are saying --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You weren't even listening, Judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I was nodding my head most of the time. And we made eye contact. I saw it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We did. I thought you were flirting.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: But look, here's the thing. You thought -- here's the thing. Now I'm going to lose my train of thought.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Wait? Are you cheating on me with him?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No. I'm cheating --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wait? Where is Harold?

utterances.speaker: RICHARD FOWLER, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: The tangled web --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. What is going on? Okay. When they say that the -- it was the vaxxed versus the un-vaxxed, he is turning the unvaxxed into Republicans.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: So he is continuing the left versus Republicans. It's the smart people versus the Trump people. And that's just not the case because in some of the studies, they say it's that most educated people who are resistant to getting the vaccine. In New York City, it is the minority community that is resistant to getting the vaccine. So if anybody is stupid here, it's Don Lemon and maybe he ought to keep his mouth shut on that stuff if he doesn't know what he's talking about.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, he's an expert in stupidity. That's the thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Richard, what should we know about, you know, the black community and hesitation because obviously there are -- at the cross (inaudible) we're talking in the green room about all of this so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why does it have to be about color?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Green? But not tell us about the minority communities, Richard. You know.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Well, I think there's some -- there is (inaudible) data coming out next week by a group that I know, HIT Strategies who does a tracking poll amongst African-Americans called BlackTrack. I'm looking forward to see what their data says about how black folks feel, their attitude towards the vaccine. But I do think this. Look, I am here for the mandates, but I don't think you can have a mandate and then shame folks who don't get the vaccine. I think you have to take that approach that doctors take when you walk in to their office and you say you're unvaccinated. They treat you with no judgment and then they begin the education process, right? What questions do you have? What are your apprehensions? How can I help answer your question? How can I help sooth your apprehension? How can I help deal with your fears, right, and begin to have this conversation. At the beginning of the pandemic, on my Instagram, I had a virologist and I asked her questions about the pandemic. And I'm willing to do it again for those folks who have questions about the vaccine.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's a good idea.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Right? And to just so we can -- and I'm happy to, right, because I think it's but educators --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're the real hero.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I try my best. Right? Because, listen, because I don't want to see another American, another black, white, yellow, purple, green die from this vaccine -- die from this pandemic. I want America to beat this pandemic. I want the globe to beat this pandemic. And because there are so many countries that are like waiting in line to get the vaccine, we have the vaccine in this country readily available. And so the only way we can beat it is by educating folks as fast and as quick as possible in getting folks to take the jab. And we have to educate people and not shame them.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Can I mention one thing, Jesse, and then we'll get all of your comments on this or otherwise? So, there's 24 attorney's general in the United States that are going -- from the states -- they are going to sue the federal government. They are Republicans. Here's what they say, "That the vaccines have helped protect millions of Americans and there are surely others who could benefit from obtaining this treatment. But convincing those who are hesitant to do so would require you to allow room for discussion and disagreement. Instead, you have offered the American people flimsy legal argument, contradictory statements and threatening directives. It is almost as if your goal is to sow division and distress rather than promote unity and the public's health. So we'll see where that lawsuit goes.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Well, the Democrats don't want to have a conversation. If you have a conversation or you even ask a question, you get nuked up social media. They don't want that. They want brute force because that's their agenda. Now, if I were president, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This is how I would handle it. First, I would thank the American people for my 50 state victory. It's quite an honor. And then I would focus less on the unvaxxed. I would focus more on the benefits of vaccines. I would say, Americans, you know, you're always chasing the fountain of youth. You know, we all want to live longer. We don't want to die young. You get a shot, you are going to live longer, and that's a fact. And I would say, hey, we're living normally. We're not wearing mask. We're doing our thing over here. Life is good. Come join us. That's the way to do it instead of shaming and calling people stupid. I would never call people stupid in this country. I would just quiz them on civics and put movie clips in the (inaudible). That's how I would handle it. But Dana, we're -- to your point, Greg, we're making a lot of progress -- 76 percent of the American people have gotten at least one shot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: In the summer, we were talking 50 percent, 60 percent. We're at 76 percent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We should be actually kind of giving ourselves a pat on the back and then a jab in the arm, but a pat on the back. We're making progress. We don't need to start punishing Americans. We need to start punishing China. Say it, Richard. China.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: China.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: China.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: American people, we would support --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: China.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- Joe Biden if he was more unifying here in this country and hey, let's come together and say, let's punish China and make China pay because Americans have paid enough.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: But I wonder, what is enough? I mean, is 80 percent enough? 90 percent enough? I mean, are they going to continue this? I mean, more variants are going to be coming in from other countries.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It shouldn't be about getting to 100 percent. It should be about we got therapeutics. We got vaccines. We're going to live with it and that's life.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You're on your own.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: But how do you deal with the misinformation like the anecdote (ph) that was put up by Nicki Minaj, right, which is a false anecdote, misinformation at its finest that impacted the globe, right? I mean, the health department of Trinidad had to stop what they were doing to correct fatal misinformation.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Consider (ph).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What did Nicki Minaj say, Richard?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I'm not going to be repeat it. I refuse to say it on air.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She brought up her cousin's friend's part of his anatomy that I will not mention here that swelled up due to it. And it brings up a really good point about assessing just any kind of anecdotal -- you need a control group. So, if -- let's say you get the jab. Ten million people get the jab and the next day, 25 of them get in car accidents. Is that the correlation or causation? No, you have to look and see, find another group of 10 million and see what the rate of car accidents are among them. You might find that people gotten fewer car accidents. So the idea of like, I talked to a lot of people that self-report symptoms and you go, you have to understand, those symptoms might have been their jab or not. You have to compare it to a control group of similar types. You also have to look at comorbidities. When a young person says I still got it you would see that they're really, really obese, which the news never tells you the weight, which you have to ask yourself, why are they so quick to shame the unvaxxed, but when you're super fit, they -- when you're super fit and you are unvaxxed somehow you're shamed, but if somebody is obese, oh, you better not say anything.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Well, Greg, to be fair. To Nicki -- to reference Nicki Minaj's tweet, if I was -- I'm not a doctor but I'm healthcare adjacent because of people in my life.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Right. If that were --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Healthcare adjacent.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: If somebody walk into --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That's like --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Am I healthcare adjacent because I'm sitting next to someone who is --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No. You're healthcare adjacent adjacent. But if somebody walks into a doctor's office and said here are my symptoms and I just took the COVID vaccine --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: -- I'm pretty sure they'll be like, well, let's take some STI test before we say that --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, that's exactly what would happen, yes, because, yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It was right before a wedding. Clearly, he was at a bachelor party.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. Ahead, Republicans demand an answer as the heat turns up on General Mark Milley's call with China.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Fox News alert. The Durham investigation has an indictment. A lawyer whose firm represented Hillary Clinton's campaign is charged with lying to the FBI. Let's go to David Spunt for those breaking news.

utterances.speaker: DAVID SPUNT, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Hi, Jesse. This attorney's name is Michael Sussmann. He is a well-known cyber security attorney here in Washington, D.C. He was just indicted a couple of hours ago by a federal grand jury as you mentioned, for lying to the FBI. And essentially what happened, September 19, 2016, almost five years ago to the day, Mr. Sussmann met with the FBI general counsel to meet with him and allege that then-candidate Donald Trump had connections to Russia. Negative connections to Russia. What Mr. Sussmann did not disclose according to Special Counsel John Durham is that not only did he worked for the DNC in 2016. He also did some work for the Hillary Clinton campaign. That is the crux of this story. He makes his first appearance before a federal judge tomorrow. This is the second indictment in the John Durham special counsel investigation. Back to you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thanks, David. And we're going to keep you guys updated on that story as it develops. Meantime, more fall out for the Biden administration after saying its got total confidence in General Mark Milley. Remember the new book claiming the general called China to undermine Trump? And so far, nobody is denying that the calls took place. The key now is to find out what was said. And Republican lawmakers are demanding answers.

utterances.speaker: NIKKI HALEY, FORMER U.S. AMBASSADOR TO U.N.
utterances.utterance: And for you to go and have the call with the Chinese, there's nothing wrong with that. For you not to tell the president that you had that call with the Chinese and for him not to be aware that's the problem. Is because you want him to be all informed and at his best to proceed. You don't have the back of the Chinese. You have the back of your president.

utterances.speaker: JOHN RATCLIFFE, FORMER DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE
utterances.utterance: If in fact that is true, then those would be individual counts of insubordination and the appropriate, you know, action would be, you know, court-martial proceeding.

utterances.speaker: REP. JIM JORDAN (R-OH)
utterances.utterance: He actually told the Chinese, hey, if we're going to do something, we're going to give you a heads up? I mean, that is so unconstitutional, so wrong.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And Republican Senator John Kennedy is suggesting Biden might scapegoat Milley to distract from his Afghanistan failure.

utterances.speaker: SEN. JOHN KENNEDY (R-LA)
utterances.utterance: I know President Biden has said he will stand behind General Milley. And maybe that's true for the short term, but I'm going to give you even odds that eventually the White House throws him under the bus. Because the White House desperately needs someone besides President Biden on which to blame the stunning incompetence in Afghanistan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let's hear your predictions, Judge. Does Milley skate on this or does he get canned?

utterances.speaker: PORRI
utterances.utterance: You know, I don't have the slightest idea. But what I can't tell you is this. If things get really bad, if the coronavirus, I mean, if they can't get more people vaccinated, the economy is going to -- can I say it? And, yes, Afghanistan is a mess. We're leaving Americans behind. The border is a mess. Inflation is a mess. I mean, somebody has got to go. If anyone goes, he goes. Look, and I wouldn't be sorry to hear him going because apparently there's only two people who can give him permission to call his Chinese counterpart, assuming that he said what Woodward is a saying he said, and that is the president or the acting secretary of defense which was this guy, Miller. And that both have said we didn't give him permission to do that. So, you know, it's all about civilian control over the military. I don't like him responding to Nancy Pelosi's calls where she is screaming after January 6th. He gets his withies in a tizzy and he decides that he's going to go to everybody who is involved in the nuclear weapons issue and he's going to tell them come to me first? Since when do they come to you first? You go to the president first.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Nancy Pelosi is not in the chain of command. All of a sudden she is, Richard. How did that happen?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I can't speak to that, but --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's the topic.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No, I'm going to -- the topic is whether or not he spoke to the Chinese.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I know, but that's a part of the story. Speak to it, Richard. The floor is yours.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Only in your mind. But I think we should work at actually getting all the facts before we just jump to conclusions. Number one --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why would we do that?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Well, because we're the news, maybe.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Well, but number one, any time a book publisher is releasing a book, what they do is they find the most salacious lines of the book and they release them out so people like us can chew over them and because our politics has become so absolutism, so people like the politicians that we just saw there, most of them will likely be 2020 --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: But Milley didn't deny it.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Hold on a minute, judge. Hold on a minute --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He didn't deny it.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Hold -- because he's not -- he's doing his job. He's not going to deny it. He's not going to get in the weeds on this. His job is to run the military. So what you have is --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: To advise the president. That's his job.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: What you have here --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He should advise him.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: What you have here is a line released from a book, right, that was clearly sensationalized and then you have actual journalists supporting like our very own Jennifer Griffin who reported that number one, this call didn't happen in secret. Number two, the first call that happened with the Chinese general and with Milley involved was a call that was initiated by the Defense Secretary Esper. And so, before we get into this -- and we also had our very own Jack Keane who talked about this and says before we jump, let's get all the facts, number one, and let's not call for transcripts because many times, when these calls happen, they happen in secret because they could be talking about a lot of things. The moment this stuff gets started -- gets released out to the public, we destroyed back channels that we have between us and other foreign governments, especially foreign governments that we have bad relationships with because you don't -- we want to be able to --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I do the Ukraine phone call.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: -- obscure the idea of us going to nuclear war with them.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is -- that is the Pentagon's opinion. Dana, do you think when Woodward and Costa reported this that maybe they got a leak of the transcripts? Do you think someone told them who was on the call exactly what happened? It's not like they would make something like this up.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay. Well, all right. Well, I don't know if there's a transcript. I don't even know if there are transcript of those -- there might be transcripts at the Defense Department. I don't know how that works. I would doubt that they got a transcript. I would imagine that this was a description of what was happening in general. It's because -- actually the accusation is quite general. And that's why we're saying well, we -- could we get the facts to find out what was said and then what was the chain of command? So, did the secretary of defense know or did the secretary of defense's deputy know? Is that good enough? I don't know. He'll have to answer that as will. Well, I also wonder about this because Costa and Woodward are not just any old authors like somebody who wrote "How I Saved the World," "Everything Will Be Okay" or "The Plus." Okay, nothing in the books that we write --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Don't pander with me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- is actually news -- is actually like, you know, breaking news.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: These two are, well, especially Costa. He is a reporter for "The Washington Post." General Milley is the -- in the office of the Joint Chiefs. He is advising a president as we speak, Trump and then Biden. So, if this guy is usurping the commander-in-chief that's big news.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And that should not be held to have a one line leak to sell a bunch of books for us to then find out next week that actually it was all nuance and context doesn't actually allow us to ruin this guy's life? So I'm skeptical about it. I'm not saying it didn't happen. I just don't know and I'm curious about how comfortable the authors are that this is happening.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And if you're Joe Biden, you can't trust this guy, Milley, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't know if he knows what's going on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Joe?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I mean, Joe. Yes. I do enjoy the cognitive dissonance and people who can just easily reverse this. Say it's a general going around Joe Biden's back because he believes that that mental decline has become so serious that we've got to do something. The people that would be defending Milley right now would be condemning Milley. So, you have to like to step back and do kind of like a comparison. We have impeached for less, you know, the phone calls. We've already had two phone calls under Joe Biden. We've had the call to the Afghan president to instruct him to lie. I'm sure there was nuance to that. Milley to China. They're a little bit -- you know, do we know what was on behalf of our country or was it on the behalf of something else?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not perfect phone calls.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Not perfect phone calls.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Not perfect.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, I -- Milley is a symptom of the emotional spasm that went on from 2016 to 2020. It wasn't the Americans who are having the spasm. It was the media, the people in power. It caused them to overlook a virus that was spreading out of China. It caused them to overlook riots and looting across the country. A concerted effort to disqualify law enforcement all because they hated this guy who had mean tweets and made mean jokes who is an outsider calling B.S. on all of these people, right? So, this is about getting rid of the most dangerous president in world history, the one, you know, who removed the threat of North Korea from the table, who ushered in peace from the Middle East, the Abraham Accord, who helped Operation Warp Speed begin, get off the ground, and didn't take a paycheck. Didn't take a paycheck. And yet adults like Milley have deluded themselves into thinking that this guy would invade China. That's -- this is -- that's what this is about. It's about the delusion.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: But how do you know that? I mean --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's part of the story.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Yes, but there's no facts on this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: China is concerned -- no, China called and said we're concerned about Trump. I'd say screw you. You better be.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There weren't any facts with Russia collision and you guys ran with that forever. Ahead, yet another surge at the southern border as Biden's crisis gets even worse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Another self-created crisis gets worse for President Biden. Drone footage capturing thousands of migrants under a bridge in Del Rio, Texas. New Border Patrol numbers say there were more than 200,000 migrants encounters in August including over 18,000 children. And new images show more kids abandoned at the border. Agents rescued a toddler and her infant brother who were left with a note saying they're siblings. How nice, Dana, they've left a note. You know, if this happened under Trump, the media would be calling them Trump's children, right? They call -- they'd call them Trump's babies or whatever.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They would definitely blame him. And actually, the silence from a lot of the media on this is really disturbing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How could it be that this is now Biden's fourth-worst crisis?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, so you have Afghanistan, COVID inflation, and then 208,000 people in August alone come in across the border, abandoned children. The Border Patrol is completely overwhelmed. And the national -- maybe the national focus is not on this issue. But I'll tell you where it is. In the border counties of Texas that are going to face some really tough -- anyone who's a Democrat there -- Henry Cuellar has been trying to raise the alarm on this, trying to get the Biden administration pay attention. He's a Democrat. He's probably thinking about that October 2022. Midterm. And the other person would be Mark Kelly, the Senator from Arizona. Think about how those small -- the margins are in the Senate. Mark Kelly has to run for reelection in Arizona. This is an issue for him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, you know, Jesse, the woman to my right makes a good point. We're dealing -- we're dealing with non-border privilege, right? Other states benefit from the cheap labor, but they don't have to deal with being overwhelmed at the border because that's not where they live.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, they're not coming to Manhattan, or Washington, or Georgetown, or any of those places. And if they are, it takes a little while, and then who knows what happens. The reason that the media hasn't been covering this all summer is because Biden hid the kids. Remember when the kids were out there, Biden him them. He just shipped them off to different locations all across the country when there's kids. Then, it's a humanitarian crisis. Then people feel bad for the kids. Of course, we feel bad. It's not Joe's fault. But when it's just men coming across, it's the vast majority of men crossing, single adult males. They don't want to show that, right, because that's a national security crisis, it's an economic crisis, a real border crisis that lands on Joe's platel. And Joe has lost track of the kids. He lost track of half the kids. How do you do that? You get -- traffic kids across then you just let them go right under Joe's nose. He doesn't care about kids. Next time Joe says I care about the children, it's a lie. He doesn't care about workers either. These young men come across, they steal jobs, they Western Union the money back home, they depress the wages. And he's not even sending any of them back. We just got the raw data. Like 80 percent get the stay. And then like if you get 200,000, Richard, Richard -- I'm Richard adjacent, in a month --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I'm Jesse adjacent. I don't know why you keep saying my name.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Richard adjacent. If get 200,000 they're catching in a month, 60,000 are getaways. You don't even see him. He's trying to turn Texas blue just like what they did with California. And if you're A Democrat running for president, you start off with Texas, California and New York. That is over 100 Electoral College votes right there in your pocket.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
